javadoc:
Class to build an DependencyGraph base on a acyclic function call graph.  This is useful when
 you want to process functions "bottom up".

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates a DependencyGraph of all functions in a program based on the call graph.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program to create an acyclic call graph

params.name: killThunks
params.comment: true if thunked functions should be eliminated from the graph

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a DependencyGraph of all functions in the given addressSet based on the call graph.
 Calls to or from functions outside the given address set are ignored.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program to create an acyclic call graph

params.name: set
params.comment: the address to restrict the call graph.

params.name: killThunks
params.comment: true if thunked functions should be eliminated from the graph

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a DependencyGraph of all functions in the given set of functions based on the call graph.
 Calls to or from functions not in the given set are ignored.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program to create an acyclic call graph

params.name: functions
params.comment: the set of functions to include in the call graph.

params.name: killThunks
params.comment: true if thunked functions should be eliminated from the graph

methods.name: getDependencyGraph
methods.comment: Builds the DependencyGraph for the acyclic call graph represented by this object.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the taskMonitor to use for reporting progress or cancelling.

return.comment: the DependencyGraph for the acyclic call graph represented by this object.

name: AcyclicCallGraphBuilder
comment:
Class to build an DependencyGraph base on a acyclic function call graph.  This is useful when
 you want to process functions "bottom up".
